item.title: Oil Remains Rangebound as Economic Worries Dominate
item.description: Oil prices rose but remained largely rangebound, as concerns over demand counter uncertainty in Russia

item.title: Kering Acquisition of Creed Adds Instant Scale, Capability
item.description: Kering’s acquisition of Creed adds immediate scale and capacity, RBC Capital Markets said, which likes the fragrance company’s in-house manufacturing and distribution operations.

item.title: Dollar Falls for Now, But Weakness Might Not Last
item.description: The dollar edged lower as equities rose, dampening demand for safe-haven currencies, but investors should be wary of anticipating further declines, ING said, as focus turns to data and Fed comments for signs of whether interest rates will rise again after July.

item.title: Metal Prices Rise as Dollar Slides
item.description: Base metals and gold pushed higher as the dollar faltered, helping provide a tailwind for industrial goods.

item.title: EV Startup Lordstown Files for Bankruptcy
item.description: The electric-truck maker, once cheered by investors during the SPAC boom and lauded by former President Donald Trump as a savior for a closed GM factory in Ohio, filed for bankruptcy.

item.title: Aston Martin on Track to Hit Key Financial Targets
item.description: Aston Martin said it expected to meet its targets of £2 billion in revenue and around £500 million in adjusted earnings in 2024, and with “persistent momentum”, is likely to exceed them in 2025.

item.title: Tighter Eurozone Bond Spreads Signal Affordability of Funding Costs
item.description: The spectacular tightening of eurozone sovereign bond-yield spreads suggest that risk assets have taken the recent change of central-bank tone in their stride, ING said.

item.title: China's Premier Confident of Meeting GDP Growth Target
item.description: Chinese premier Li Qiang struck a confident tone in the country’s economic performance and blasted the West’s concept of economic de-risking in a keynote speech at a meeting known as the Summer Davos.

item.title: U.K. Shop-Price Inflation Eases
item.description: Prices at U.K. stores in the first week of June were 8.4% higher on year, but lower than May’s record high of 9%. helped by cheaper fresh food as retailers cut the cost of many staples.

item.title: Japan Finance Minister Calls Yen's Moves 'One-Sided and Rapid'
item.description: The Japanese government was keeping a watchful eye on the movement of the foreign exchange market, said Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki.

item.title: Magic Mushrooms. LSD. Ketamine. The Drugs That Power Silicon Valley.
item.description: Entrepreneurs including Elon Musk and Sergey Brin are part of a psychedelic movement that proponents hope will expand minds, enhance lives and produce business breakthroughs.

item.title: The Supreme Court, in an expected move, dismissed Louisiana's emergency plea to block creation of a second Black-majority congressional district.
item.description: The Supreme Court, in an expected move, dismissed Louisiana’s emergency plea to block creation of a second Black-majority congressional district.

item.title: The person accused of carrying out a mass shooting at an LGBTQ nightclub in Colorado Springs, Colo., last November pleaded guilty to killing five people and wounding numerous others in the attack.
item.description: The person accused of carrying out a mass shooting at an LGBTQ nightclub in Colorado Springs, Colo., last November pleaded guilty to killing five people and wounding numerous others in the attack.

item.title: Wagner chief Prigozhin, who led an abortive military mutiny, defended the short-lived insurrection and claimed on Monday that he wasn't trying to oust Putin, while the Russian president blasted the organizers of a revolt that presented the most serious challenge to his 23 years in power.
item.description: Wagner chief Prigozhin, who led an abortive military mutiny, defended the short-lived insurrection and claimed on Monday that he wasn’t trying to oust Putin, while the Russian president blasted the organizers of a revolt that presented the most serious challenge to his 23 years in power.

item.title: Former Guatemalan first lady Sandra Torres and congressman Bernardo Arévalo will face off in a runoff election for the nation's presidency.
item.description: Former Guatemalan first lady Sandra Torres and congressman Bernardo Arévalo will face off in a runoff election for the nation’s presidency.

item.title: The White House kicked off a flood of new funding for state governments to spend on internet projects from the $1 trillion infrastructure law passed in 2021.
item.description: The White House kicked off a flood of new funding for state governments to spend on internet projects from the $1 trillion infrastructure law passed in 2021.

item.title: Ukraine said it made fresh territorial gains in its counteroffensive, as Kyiv looks to take advantage of the disarray gripping Russia.
item.description: Ukraine said it made fresh territorial gains in its counteroffensive, as Kyiv looks to take advantage of the disarray gripping Russia.

item.title: North Korea blamed the U.S. for bringing the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a nuclear war, sharpening its dissatisfaction with Washington as security tensions remain high across the region.
item.description: North Korea blamed the U.S. for bringing the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a nuclear war, sharpening its dissatisfaction with Washington as security tensions remain high across the region.

item.title: FTX chief Ray released a report that alleged an unnamed senior lawyer assisted Bankman-Fried in misusing customer deposits.
item.description: FTX chief Ray released a report that alleged an unnamed senior lawyer assisted Bankman-Fried in misusing customer deposits.

item.title: Jesse Watters will be the new host of Fox News's 8 p.m. hour, succeeding ousted star anchor Tucker Carlson, one of several prime-time changes announced by the network.
item.description: Jesse Watters will be the new host of Fox News’s 8 p.m. hour, succeeding ousted star anchor Tucker Carlson, one of several prime-time changes announced by the network.
